#Text=Christine Lagarde : World economy ' faces a downward spiral '

column1: #Text=Howard Schneider .
#Text=" Lagarde , in Berlin , tells Germany — and the rest of Europe — to pay up " — The Washington Post , January 23 , 2012
#Text=International Criminal Court calls for four Kenyans to face trial for communal violence

#Text=The International Criminal Court has presented formal charges against three senior Kenyan politicians and a radio executive accused of orchestrating the wave of communal violence that followed the 2007 presidential election in that country .

#Text=Of the six individuals initially investigated enough evidence to prosecute has been found in only four cases - including 2012/13 presidential hopefuls Uhuru Kenyatta and his rival William Ruto a former education minister .
#Text=Menyatta is deputy prime-minister and finance minister .
#Text=In the past the rich and powerful in Kenya have often escaped justice .
#Text=Kenyatta is the nation 's richest man .
#Text=Cathy Majtenyi .
#Text=" ICC : 4 Kenyans to Face Trial for Post-Election Violence " — Voice of America , January 23 , 2012
#Text=Marlise Simons .
#Text=" 4 Kenyans to Stand Trial at Hague Court in 2008 Violence " — The New York Times , January 23 , 2012
#Text=Syria accuses Arab League of interference as GCC withdraws observers

#Text=The Gulf Co-operation Council is to withdraw its observers from the Arab League observer mission in Syria following Syrian dismissal of plans for President Bashar al-Assad to hand power to his deputy and share power in a unity government as " flagrant interference " .
#Text=The United Nations estimate that upwards of 5000 people have died in almost a year of anti-government protests and demonstrations .
#Text=" Gulf Arab states to pull observers from Syria " — BBC , 24 January 2012

#Text=Salman Rushdie literature festival video-link cancelled over fears of violence
#Text=A planned video-link address by Salman Rushdie at the Jaipur Literature Festival has been cancelled admidst fears of violence .
#Text=Sanjoy Roy , the festival 's organiser , said " Earlier today , a number of organisations came to us and threatened violence .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=Salman Rushdie , whose book The Satanic Verses remains controversial 24 years after its publication , had earlier cancelled attending the festival citing assassination threats , and it is claimed several authors who read excerpts from The Satanic Verses in support can be prosecuted .
